# Welcome to Synthwave84
## A Retro-Futuristic Theme for reveal.js

This is a **minimal demo** of the `synthwave84-reveal.scss` theme.  
Use the `.neon-*` utility classes to emphasize text:

- [neon pink highlight]{.neon-pink}
- [neon cyan highlight]{.neon-cyan}
- [neon red highlight]{.neon-red}
- [neon green highlight]{.neon-green}

# Code Block Styling

## Advanced Theme for Code-Heavy Talks
The theme is tuned for code-heavy talks.

```r
# a tiny R example
library(dplyr)

iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  summarise(
    across(where(is.numeric), mean, .names = "avg_{.col}")
  )
```

Inline code like `summarise()` or `across()` should get the
synthwave inline chip styling.

# Two-Column Layout
## Using `.columns` Helper

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column}
### Left: Narrative

Use the `.columns7030` helper for quick
side-by-side content. This is handy for:

- Text + figure  
- Model diagram + equations  
- Code + output  

You can also sprinkle in  
<span class="neon-yellow">keyword-like emphasis</span>.

:::

::: {.column}

### Right: Visual

- Drop an image here (e.g., `![](fig.png)`)  
- Or a small table:  

| x | y |
|---|---|
| 1 | A |
| 2 | B |

:::
::::
